metadata.title: CVE-2022-1096 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
Type confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 99.0.4844.84 allowed aremote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTMLpage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1096` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 99.0.4844.84-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 99.0.4844.84-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 99.0.4844.84-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 99.0.4844.84-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 99.0.4844.84-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '99.0.4844.84-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
